Class SyntaxAnalyser

  • java.lang.Object
    • AbstractSyntaxAnalyser
      • SyntaxAnalyser

  • public class SyntaxAnalyser
extends AbstractSyntaxAnalyser
    Code: Syntax Analyser SyntaxAnalyser.java Date: 25/02/19 Syntax analyser class which extends the AbstractSyntaxAnalyser superclass. Used for analysing the terminals and non-terminals contained within a given file.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SyntaxAnalyser(java.lang.String filename)
      Initialises a new syntax analyser object for a given file.

        public SyntaxAnalyser(java.lang.String filename)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Initialises a new syntax analyser object for a given file.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file to read tokens from.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IOException occured such as the provided file doesn't exist.

      • reportError

        public void reportError(java.lang.String errorStr)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        CompilationException
        Reports an error to the output.txt file and throws a CompilationException at the end.
        Parameters:
        errorStr - the human-readable error to output.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IOException occured.
        CompilationException - if a compilation error occured.

      • formatErrString

        public java.lang.String formatErrString(java.lang.String expected)
        Formats an error string to be output to the output.txt file.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the formatted error string.

      • checkIfDeclared

        public Variable checkIfDeclared(Token token)
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                CompilationException
        Checks if a provided token has been declared yet based on its text (i.e. identifier).
        Parameters:
        token - the token to check.
        Returns:
        the declared variable.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IOException occured.
        CompilationException - if a compilation error occured.

      • commenceNonterminal

        public void commenceNonterminal(java.lang.String nonTerminal)
        Commences a non terminal symbol by calling the relevant method in the Generate class. This method also provides output indentation for easier reading (+ less repetition).
        Parameters:
        nonTerminal - the non terminal string to commence.

      • finishNonterminal

        public void finishNonterminal(java.lang.String nonTerminal)
        Finishes a non terminal symbol by calling the relevant method in the Generate class. This method also provides output indentation for easier reading (+ less repetition).
        Parameters:
        nonTerminal - the non terminal string to finish.

      • addVariable

        public Variable addVariable(java.lang.String variableIdentifier,
                            Variable.Type type)
        Attempt to add the variable to the list. If declaring, indent output ready for printing, otherwise ignore.
        Parameters:
        variableIdentifier - the identifier of the variable to add.
        type - the type of the variable.
        Returns:
        the added variable.

      • removeVariable

        public void removeVariable(Variable v)
        Removes a variable from the list. If the variable hasn't been removed yet, indent the output ready for printing and remove it.
        Parameters:
        v - the variable to remove.

      • indent

        public void indent()
        Indents a line in the output.txt file showing the parse tree.
